venues.name: Arab American National Museum
venues.description: The Arab American National Museum (AANM) is the first and only museum of its kind in the United States devoted to recording the Arab American experience. Since opening in 2005, AANM’s mission has been to document, preserve and present the history, culture and contributions of Arab Americans. The exhibitions cover the Arab world and the history of Arab Americans from the first immigrants who arrived in the late 19th century to today. AANM has one of the most extensive archives of Arab American historical documents, oral histories and artifacts. They are the only museum in the country that actively collects Arab American art.

venues.name: The Aretha Franklin Ampitheatre
venues.description: Aretha Franklin Amphitheatre is the most exciting concert space in the heart of downtown Detroit. This unique waterfront venue is the epicenter of live entertainment in the summer for metropolitan Detroit.

venues.name: Beacon Park
venues.description: Beacon Park opened in July 2017 and spans 1.2 acres in Downtown Detroit. It features stunning light installations, an open lawn space and a contemporary two-story restaurant. The park hosts a program of daily organized activities from musical performances and children’s events, to art installations, local markets and more.

venues.name: Belle Isle Aquarium
venues.description: The Belle Isle Aquarium was designed by famed Detroit architect, Albert Kahn, and opened on August 18, 1904. It is the oldest aquarium in the country and has served the Detroit community as a beloved attraction for generations.

venues.name: Belle Isle Park
venues.description: Belle Isle Park is a 982-acre island park located in Detroit with historic, environmental, and cultural resources that have been beloved for generations. The park is home to the Belle Isle Aquarium, Anna Scripps Whitcomb Conservatory, Dossin Great Lakes Museum, Belle Isle Nature Center, the James Scott Memorial Fountain, and more. The Belle Isle Conservancy's mission is to protect, preserve, restore and enhance the natural environment, historic structures, and unique character of Belle Isle as a public park for the enjoyment of all – now and forever.

venues.name: Belle Isle Nature Center
venues.description: The Belle Isle Nature Center is located on the beautiful Belle Isle State Park, which offers the perfect location for educational, environmental and natural experiences in the metro Detroit area. This also makes it possible for the Nature Center to provide excellent educational experiences for schools, families and community groups.

venues.name: Campus Martius Park
venues.description: Campus Martius Park is a city of Detroit treasure and a national and international destination. In 2021, Campus Martius Park was named “Top Public Square” by USA Today and has won countless awards for public space design, management, operations, placemaking, and programming. In the heart of Downtown, Campus Martius Park is Detroit’s Gathering Place for both residents and visitors. This famous park was created in 2004 at the site of Detroit’s point of origin located at 0 miles, where the vision for the city’s plan was originally laid out by Augustus Woodward in 1805.

venues.name: Comerica Park
venues.description: Comerica Park is a baseball stadium located in Downtown Detroit. It has been the home of Major League Baseball's Detroit Tigers since 2000, when the team left Tiger Stadium. Catch a spectacular view of the Detroit skyline from Comerica Park, home of the Detroit Tigers. Fans flock to Comerica Park each summer to cheer on the Tigers. Not only home to the Detroit Tigers, Comerica Park has also hosted some of the biggest entertainment acts in the world.

venues.name: The Crofoot
venues.description: The Crofoot Presents is Southeast Michigan’s most dynamic independent event promotion company. Each year, The Crofoot and affiliated companies produce more than 750 live events, including concerts, corporate events, weddings, festivals, and more. The history of the company dates back to 1979 with the conversion of Saint Andrews Hall from underused fraternal hall into legendary Detroit nightspot. Together with a team of partners, Saint Andrews Hall was used as a springboard for expansion to other venues: The Shelter, Industry Night Club, 7th House, Clutch Cargo’s, and the music promotion company Ritual.

venues.name: Detroit Historical Museum
venues.description: When attorney and historian Clarence M. Burton donated his collection of historical papers to the Detroit Public Library in 1914, he triggered a chain of events that led to the creation of the Detroit Historical Museum. In December 1921, Burton brought together 19 prominent local historians to found the Detroit Historical Society, an organization dedicated to the preservation of the city’s history. In 1927, membership offices were leased and our treasurer J. Bell Moran was appointed to set up a museum. A new permanent exhibit opened in 1995 -- The Motor City. This exhibit traces Detroit’s development into the Automobile Capital of the World and includes an operating assembly line with a two-story body drop from the General Motors Cadillac Division Clark Street Plant.

venues.name: The Detroit Zoo
venues.address: 8450 W 10 Mile Rd, Royal Oak, MI 48067

venues.name: The Detroit Institute of Arts
venues.description: The Detroit Institute of Arts has one of the largest and most significant art collections in the United States. With more than 65,000 artworks that date from the earliest civilizations to the present, the museum offers visitors an encounter with human creativity from all over the world.

venues.name: Dossin Great Lakes Museum
venues.description: Located on Strand Drive on Belle Isle, the Dossin Great Lakes Museum is dedicated to showcasing the story of the Great Lakes, with a special emphasis on Detroit’s role in regional and national maritime history. The visitors at this 16,000 square foot museum enjoy exhibits that tell more than 300 years of the region’s rich maritime history, from the shipping fleets that rule the waterways to the varied roles that the Great Lakes and the Detroit River have played in the region’s industrial and social history.

venues.name: Eastern Market
venues.description: Eastern Market (Detroit) is the destination in the heart of the city with fresh food, restaurants, businesses, art and culture and over 150 years of rich history.

venues.name: El Club
venues.description: El Club is an all ages arts venue in Southwest Detroit. We serve wood fired pizza in house, and have a full bar. Please note the bar and food service is only available on days of events or live performances.

venues.name: The Fillmore
venues.description: The Fillmore Detroit is a beautiful historic venue located in the heart of Detroit's entertainment district. Originally opened in 1925 as a movie house, this elegant venue has been renovated to offer guests a unique concert and special event experience. As you walk through the grand lobby of The Fillmore Detroit you are embraced by the nostalgia of the original Fillmore chandeliers and the history they represent.

venues.name: Fisher Theater
venues.description: Redesigned in 1961, this historic, rosewood & brass theater hosts shows bound for Broadway.

venues.name: Ford Field
venues.description: Ford Field is the premier family entertainment destination committed to providing unparalleled service by exceeding the expectations of each of our guests. Ford Field works to continually create unique and exciting experiences in a fun, friendly environment. Ford Field was built in 2002 to be the official home of the NFL Detriot Lions and was designed to incorporate the existing site infrastructure, the Hudson warehouse.
